meanings.definition: To handle or deal with something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: She always prehandles her assignments to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent2: He prehandles all the paperwork before the meeting to ensure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The student prehandles his homework so well that he finishes it before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The chef prehandles all the ingredients like a conductor orchestrating a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The detective prehandles the evidence, carefully examining each clue for any hidden secrets.

meanings.definition: To prepare or plan in advance.
meanings.sent1: They prehandles their travel itinerary to make the most of their trip.
meanings.sent2: The team prehandles their strategy before the big game to outsmart their opponents.
meanings.sent3: The family prehandles their holiday decorations, making their house the most festive on the block.
meanings.sent4: The scientist prehandles the experiment meticulously, ensuring accurate results.
meanings.sent5: The teacher prehandles the lesson plan, incorporating engaging activities for the students.
